Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2009 12:12AM Lynn3 wrote: The best advice is to take a breath, maybe several. You are getting bombarded with so much to think about and then there is your family and life. It is a lot to take on, but it will get easier. Ask, ask and ask questions. Call the doctor if a question arises that you need answers to. They are there to help you. We are too. Prayers are bounding your way. As for your children, I always felt that children, no matter what age, can deal with what they know. And their imaginations cause a lot more harm. With knowledge comes power.......but sometimes in small doses. Concentrate on yourself for awhile and we will help you through this. God bless you.

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2009 12:28AM Lynn3 wrote: Dear All, I just had a DIEP last May (on our anniversary), spent 5 days in hospital, stayed in a lift chair for a long time...actually rather comfy. I had to mess with the drains but had help with them and they were out soon enough. Also had help showering especially with the drains. A CNA who wanted to earn extra money came to help. I am sooooo glad I did that. I am soooo glad I was able to do that. It has worked for me. Let me know if you need anymore experience/advice than you are already getting.
